contentrichtext.text: '''José Szapocznik, Ph.D.''', (born in [[Havana]], [[Cuba]]), is a clinical [[psychologist]] of [[Poles|Polish]]-[[Cubans|Cuban]] ancestry and one of the nation's leading family therapists specializing in [[Hispanic]] families. He is the developer of One-Person Family [[Family therapy|Therapy]] and Brief Structural Therapy. He is a leading scholar on Hispanic [[psychology]].<ref name=fj>Brian J. Distelberg, Family Journal, "History of Evidence-Based Practices: An Interview With José Szapocznik", [http://tfj.sagepub.com/cgi/content/abstract/1066480707313823v1]</ref> He is director of the Center for Family Studies at the [[University of Miami]],<ref name=cffs>Center for Family Studies website [http://www.cfs.med.miami.edu/Docs/WhatsNew.htm]</ref>where he has been inducted into its [[Iron Arrow Honor Society]]. He has authored numerous scientific publications and has received numerous awards for his work on behalf of Hispanic families. ==References== {{reflist}} *National Hispanic Science Network [http://nhsn.med.miami.edu/x161.xml?id=j_szapocznik] *PsycNet [http://psycnet.apa.org/index.cfm?fa=buy.optionToBuy&id=1992-28896-001&CFID=5979642&CFTOKEN=27767162] (pay for article) {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Szapocznik, Jose | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = AMerican psychologist | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Szapocznik, Jose}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American academics]] [[Category:American psychologists]] [[Category:American people of Cuban descent]] [[Category:People from Florida]]
